comments:
I get an AssertionFailedException when I drag a file from the Project Explorer
across its scroll bar.

Here is how to set up the workbench to recreate the problem:

1) Open the Java perspective
2) Open the Project Explorer view.
3) Drag the Project Explorer view from the site/location where the
   Problems view is to the site/location where the Java Package Explorer is.
4) Fill up the contents displayed in the Project Explorer with projects
   and files so that it has a scroll bar.
5) Open the Java editor for a Java file
6) Drag a Java file from the Project Explorer over the scroll bar.
   Be careful to drag it exactly horizontally so as not to cause the
   object above or below it in the Package Explorer to highlight as
   a drop target.  Also, drag it slowly - you do not always see the
   exception if you move the cursor quickly.  When the drag cursor enters
   the scroll bar, the AssertionFailedException is logged to the Error log.

I've also seen the problem dragging files with other types, but sometimes
the exception is not issued and sometimes I have to drop the file
with the other file type onto the scroll bar.

I have described carefully how to set up your workbench to recreate
the problem, and it might be viewed as an odd setup.  We encounter
this exact problem with the default perspective of the Websphere
Integration Developer (WID).  I ran into the problem with no specific
setup required.  Rather than explain the problem using the WID 
perspective, I thought it would be beneficial to describe how
to recreate the problem on a "scaled down" eclipse environment.

Here is the exception logged to the Error log:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 159073 ***
